DISCLOSURE_INFO:
{
  "Allegations" : "CLIENT CLAIMED HE INSTRUCTED ME TO PLACE THE FUNDS INVESTED IN AN ANNUITY (IN 2001) IN A FIXED ACCOUNT.  CLIENT ALLEGES I PLACED THE FUNDS IN A MONEY MARKET ACCOUNT AND CLIENT BEGAN LOSING MONEY.  CLIENT INDICATED HE EVENTUALLY SURRENDERED THE ANNUITY AS CLIENT FEARED INCURRING ADDITIONAL LOSSES.  CLIENT REQUESTS THE FIRM REIMBURSE HIM FOR THE CDSC ASSOCIATED WITH THE SURRENDER, WHICH CLIENT ESTIMATES TO BE APPROXIMATELY $10,000. ",
  "DisplayAAOLinkIfExists" : "N",
  "arbitrationClaimFiledDetail" : "",
  "arbitrationDocketNumber" : "",
  "Broker Comment" : "I DENY THESE ALLEGATIONS.  CUSTOMER LOOKED AT A FIXED BUCKET IN HIS VA AND CHOSE INSTEAD A DCA BONUS INTO THE MONEY MARKET. IT IS MY OPINION THAT HE UNDERSTOOD HE COULD MOVE TO FIXED ACCOUNT AT ANY TIME.  I FEEL THE ISSUE IS THAT HE WOULD LOSE HIS DCA BONUS IF HE CHOSE THE FIXED ACCOUNT. IT IS MY UNDERSTANDING THAT HE HAS SINCE CASHED IN AND BOUGHT A HIGH BONUS ANNUITY WHICH WOULD OFFSET HIS SURRENDER FEES ENTIRELY. *** 6/9/04 - CLIENT'S INITIAL COMPLAINT, WHICH WAS NON-FILEABLE, WAS DENIED. SUBSEQUENTLY, THE CLIENT HAS INDICATED THE FUNDS INVESTED IN THE ANNUITIES WERE TO BE PLACED IN FIXED SUB-ACCOUNTS. SINCE THE ANNUITIES WERE PURCHASED, THE CLIENT HAS RECEIVED STATEMENTS (FROM EDWARD JONES AS WELL AS THE ANNUITY COMPANY) WHICH PROVIDE INFORMATION REGARDING THE ANNUITIES TO INCLUDE SUB-ACCOUNT ALLOCATIONS AND VALUE(S). IN REVIEWING STATEMENTS, IT APPEARS THE FUNDS WERE INITIALLY ALLOCATED TO THE DCA PLUS 12 SUB-ACCOUNT. THIS SUB-ACCOUNT GENERALLY ENABLES A CLIENT TO MOVE FUNDS TO OTHER AVAILABLE SUB-ACCOUNTS OVER A PERIOD OF TIME. THE FUNDS CONTINUING TO BE HELD IN THE DCA SUB-ACCOUNT EARNED A FIXED RATE WHILE THE PORTION OF FUNDS MOVED TO OTHER SUB-ACCOUNTS MAY BE SUBJECT TO MARKET FLUCTUATION. ACCORDING TO STATEMENT INFORMATION, FUNDS WITHIN THE ANNUITIES WERE MOVED FROM THE DCA SUB-ACCOUNT TO THE MONEY MARKET SUB-ACCOUNT AND WERE SUBSEQUENTLY MOVED TO A FIXED SUB-ACCOUNT. BASED ON OUR REVIEW, NO NEW INFORMATION HAS BEEN PROVIDED WHICH WARRANTS A CHANGE IN THE FIRM'S POSITION REGARDING THIS MATTER. CLAIM DENIED.   "
}

{
  "Allegations" : "ALLEGATIONS OF NEGLIGENCE, MISREPRESENTATION, INTENTIONAL MISREPRESENTATION, UNCONSCIONABLE CONTRACT AND PROMISSORY ESTOPPEL WHEN MCPHERSON ALLEGEDLY INDUCED PLAINTIFF TO CANCEL HIS DEFERRED COMPENSATION FULL LIFE INSURANCE POLICY WORTH $148,000 AND INVEST IT INTO A TERM LIFE POLICY AND SEVERAL HIGH RISK STOCKS. ******ARBITRATION ALLEGATIONS: MISREPRESENTATION OF FACT, SUITABILITY AND OMISSION OF FACTS IN ADVISING CLAIMANT TO TRANSFER THE VALUE OF HIS DEFERRED COMPENSATION FULL LIFE POLICY INTO A PROTECTIVE LIFE INSURANCE VARIABLE LIFE TERM POLICY. (AMOUNT CLAIMED: APPROXIMATELY $256,000, THE COST OF A $1 MILLION POLICY, AND $500,000 IN PUNITIVE DAMAGES.)",
  "Damage Amount Requested" : "$256,000.00",
  "Settlement Amount" : "$80,000.00",
  "DisplayAAOLinkIfExists" : "Y",
  "arbitrationClaimFiledDetail" : "04-02692",
  "arbitrationDocketNumber" : "",
  "Broker Comment" : "CIVIL LITIGATION RESOLUTION:  MOTION TO COMPEL ARBITRATION GRANTED.  CASE STAYED PENDING ARBITRATION. ARBITRATION SERVED ON 4/30/04.**************ARBITRATION RESOLUTION:  SETTLED FOR $80,000 FROM JONES PLUS $10,000 FROM PROTECTIVE."
}

{
  "Allegations" : "CLIENT'S WIFE WROTE COMPLAINT AND CLAIMS THEY TOLD IR THEY DID NOT WANT HIGH RISK STOCKS.  WIFE STATES THEY WERE PLACED IN THE JOHN HANCOCK REGIONAL BANK FUND AND THE VALUE INCREASED; HOWEVER, THEY CLAIM THE IR NEVER SUGGESTED THEY REMOVE ANY PROFITS. WIFE STATES THE STOCK THEN PLUNGED AND IR RECOMMENDED TO MOVE THE FUNDS TO THE HEALTH SCIENCES FUND AND ASSURED THEM THE FUNDS WERE LOW RISK. WIFE INDICATED THEY LOST HALF OF THE $23,000.  WIFE STATES THEY HAVE SINCE LEARNED THAT THEY ARE INVESTED IN SECTOR FUNDS AND THEY ARE HIGH RISK.   ",
  "Damage Amount Requested" : "$11,500.00",
  "DisplayAAOLinkIfExists" : "N",
  "arbitrationClaimFiledDetail" : "",
  "arbitrationDocketNumber" : "",
  "Broker Comment" : "ACCORDING TO OUR RECORDS, INVESTMENTS (SOME PURCHASED AS EARLY AS 1996) WERE TRANSFERRED FROM A SINGLE REGISTRATION ACCOUNT TO THE CLIENT'S TRUST ACCOUNT IN OCTOBER 2001. IR INDICATED HE DISCUSSED THE ACCOUNT WITH THE CLIENT (IN PERSON AND VIA TELEPHONE) ON MULTIPLE OCCASIONS DURING THE TIME IR SERVICED THE ACCOUNT. IT IS UNDERSTOOD THE CLIENT WAS CONCERNED WITH PROVIDING FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO HER CHILDREN WHICH RESULTED IN THE ORIGINATION OF THE LOAN IN THE ACCOUNT. IR STATED THE CLIENT WAS AWARE OF THE POTENTIAL FOR MARGIN CALLS WHILE MAINTAINING A LOAN BALANCE. ACCORDING TO OUR RECORDS, THE LOAN WAS ORIGINATED IN JUNE 1998 AND REMAINED OUTSTANDING UNTIL SEPTEMBER 2001. AT THE TIME OF THE TRANSACTIONS (PURCHASES/SELLS), THE CLIENT RECEIVED TRADE CONFIRMATIONS WHICH PROVIDED DETAILS OF THE TRANSACTIONS. IN ADDITION, THE CLIENT HAS RECEIVED STATEMENTS WHICH PROVIDE INFORMATION REGARDING THE INVESTMENTS PURCHASED IN THE ACCOUNTS AS WELL AS REFLECTING ACCOUNT ACTIVITY (INCLUDING MARGIN ACTIVITY). BASED ON OUR REVIEW, IT IS OUR OPINION THE INVESTMENTS PURCHASED AND/OR HELD IN THE ACCOUNT ARE NOT OUTSIDE THE SCOPE OF THE INVESTMENT OBJECTIVES OF THE ACCOUNT. FURTHERMORE, IT WOULD APPEAR ALL TRANSACTIONS EFFECTED IN THE ACCOUNT (INCLUDING LOAN ACTIVITY) WERE AUTHORIZED. CLAIM DENIED.   "
}

{
  "Allegations" : "CLIENT INDICATES SHE IS 75 YEARS OLD AND HAS A SMALL ESTATE.  CLIENT STATES HER INVESTMENTS WERE PUT INTO UNSUITABLE RISK TAKING INTO CONSIDERATION HER AGE AND ESTATE SIZE. CLIENT INDICATES SHE DID NOT UNDERSTAND THE IMPLICATIONS OF THE MARGIN ACCOUNT AND AS THE MARKET VALUES DROPPED SHE WAS RECEIVING MARGIN CALLS DURING 2001.  CLIENT WOULD LIKE TO BE REIMBURSED FOR THE LOSSES.  LOSSES EXCEED $5,000. ",

{
  "Allegations" : "CLIENT ALLEGES MCPHERSON REPLACED AN EXISTING INSURANCE POLICY WITH A \"HIGHLY  AGGRESSIVE FUND\" WHICH WAS NOT SUITABLE.  ALSO, ALLEGES HE WAS NOT INFORMED OF  THE RATING ON THE NEW POLICY AND MCPHERSON DID NOT EXPLAIN THE NEW POLICY  (I.E. COMMISSIONS, RISKS, SURRENDER FEES).  CLIENT REQUESTS A FULL REVIEW OF THE  SITUATION.  CLIENT REQUESTS FULL RESTITUTION.  ALLEGED DAMAGES EXCEED $5,000.00.",
  "Damage Amount Requested" : "$5,000.00",
  "DisplayAAOLinkIfExists" : "N",
  "arbitrationClaimFiledDetail" : "",
  "arbitrationDocketNumber" : "",
  "Broker Comment" : "CLIENT RECEIVED A RESPONSE FROM PROTECTIVE LIFE REGARDING THIS SITUATION WHICH  APPEARS TO ADDRESS THE ISSUES BROUGHT FORTH.  ACCORDING TO PROTECTIVE LIFE, THE  APPROPRIATE REPLACEMENT AND 1035 PAPERWORK WAS COMPLETED AND RECEIVED.   MCPHERSON HAS INDICATED HE EXPLAINED THE RATING OF THE POLICY TO THE INSURED.  PROTECTIVE LIFE SENT A LETTER REGARDING THE RATING TO THE INSURED  ON 7/13/2000.  IN ADDITION, THE INSURED SIGNED AN \"AMENDMENT TO APPLICATION\" ON 7/19/000 WHICH EXPLAINED THE RATING.  MCPHERSON HAS ALSO STATED HE EXPLAINED THE  FEES AND/OR SALES CHARGES ASSOCIATED WITH THE PURCHASE OF THE POLICY.  IN  ADDITION, INFORMATION REGARDING THE FEES AND/OR SALES CHARGES IS ALSO PROVIDED  IN THE POLICY.  BASED ON OUR REVIEW, MCPHERSON MADE THE APPROPRIATE DISCLOSURES  REGARDING THE PURCHASE OF THE POLICY.  CLAIM DENIED."
}

  "Allegations" : "THE CLIENT SOLD MANY OF THEIR MUTUAL FUNDS IN THE YEAR 2000. THE CLIENT HAS PROVIDED A COPY OF THEIR  SHORT TERM CAPITAL GAINS AND LOSSES FROM THEIR TAX FILING WHICH INDICATES THEY  WERE REQUIRED TO PAY TAXES ON $30,014 IN GAINS. ",

MCPHERSON STATES HE SPECIFICALLY TOLD THE CLIENT THERE  WOULD BE TAXES, HOWEVER, THE CLIENT WAS CONCERNED WITH GETTING OUT OF THE FUNDS  SO THEY WOULD NOT CONTINUE TO LOSE MONEY.  CLAIM DENIED "
